description.narrative: The project strengthens the industrial trade unions of Malawi by increasing union density, improving rights awareness and developing cooperation between unions. First there will be a mapping to find out the primary organizing target companies and areas, an d based on that a more detailed campaign plan will be elaborated, after which shop stewards, leaders and activists participate in organizing skills training and start recruiting at workplace level. Current and new members will benefit from training on basi c rights that is expected to create a basis for active union work and help identify future shop stewards and leaders. In the poor country of Malawi workers face almost all problems one can imagine from low salaries to inadequate health and safety measures and poor awareness level to union hostile attitudes of employers. By strengthening the unions the workers will get a credible actor to defend their interests and improve the living conditions of workers and their families. As immediate results the union me mbership numbers will grow and workers? awareness and knowledge levels will increase. The beneficiaries are industrial workers and their four unions. The project is implemented by IndustriALL Global Union and its Malawian affiliates Building, Construction, Civil Engineering and Allied Workers Union (BCCEAWU), Textile, Garment, Leather, Security Services and Allied Workers Union (TGLSSEWU), Commercial, Industrial and Allied Workers Union (CIAWU) and Chemical, Energy, Mines and Allied Workers Union (CEMAWU).
